posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
Welcome on board and I hope (well, we all hope, I'm certain) that you will learn and contribute ideas about character building.

Now, to your questions, which probably would be best posted to the general subforum since it doesn't really involve a specific build per se...

Open Locks
It's a d20 skill check based on DEX. So that means if your toon has 43 ranks in OL, say 30 DEX (+10, about average for a dexer), Trickery Domain via Cleric (let's say Cleric 24 for +13), SkF/ESkF (+13) and +10 lockpicks, you'd be able to open locks with DC of at least 109 (if I added correctly) with a Take 20 non-combat. I'm intentionally ignoring the +2 synergy, in this case. I'd say levels like this would be tremendous overkill even without the max possible values in effect. The fact is, locks can be set to plot and then unlockable by any skill level and unbashable. Or they can be simply bashed via physical means or spells. Not sure what your intent is to max the skill but that should at least put things into better perspective. IMO it is pointless to attempt it even in a roleplay environment.

Disarm Traps
To disarm all traps except epic ones requires 16 modified ranks in Disable Traps, non-combat. For the 4 epic traps (Elec/Fire/Frost/Sonic), your toon would need to be rogue first off and then obtain a skill level of 38 with a combo of any/all of the modifiers listed for Open Locks except INT is the ability modifier. This only accounts for designed traps, not those set by other toons.

Also, one skill that is missing from your roguish skill list is Search. If you can't detect a trap it is difficult to disable it!

Set Traps
To set all traps except epic ones requires 25 modified ranks in Set Traps, non-combat. For the 4 epic traps (Elec/Fire/Frost/Sonic), your toon would need to obtain a skill level of 45 with a combo of any/all of the modifiers listed for Open Locks.

The feat Skill Mastery, available only to rogues with at least 10 levels, allows a Take 20 even when in combat.

I hope that helps to answer your inquiry though the goal of such a build eludes me.

Empyre65 wrote:Years ago, I was told that you can disable any traps except epic traps with a modified Disarm Traps score of 16, but recently when I payed the OC, there were some traps that needed a score of 17 or even higher. I wound up diverting pojnts that were planned for other skills to boost Disarm Traps to 20, which might have been a little higher than needed.
It's not just the Disable Trap level involved. You must add Take 20 to that as long as it is not during combat. In combat, you must roll a d20 and add that to Disable ranks. Therefore, Take 20 plus Disable of 16 = 36. The most difficult trap DC to disarm are deadly Fire, Electrical & Gas, all set at 36 in vanilla. DCs can be customized, naturally, in which case you'd need higher scores. AFAIK all traps in the standard Bioware campaigns follow the standard toolset defaults and there are NO epic traps populated in those campaigns, which would need a rogue to disable anyway. I've scrubbed the campaign modules pretty thoroughly and except for plot-related placeables I'd be interested to know where you encountered those that have been customized.

A less vested way to boost the skill is just via INT modifier which caps at +6 to INT skills like Disable Traps. With Fox's Cunning (Empowered even better) and Rings of Clear Thought it should be very easy to reach the +12 ability cap even without high INT. In the OC specifically, there are standard roguish skill booster items like Amulet of the Master and Ring of the Rogue (quest reward) usable by all classes to boost all those skills significantly. Probably the toughest trap in the OC is the one in the first floor of Helm's Hold, a deadly version but even that one has been relaxed down to 34 by the design team. That one requires a modified skill level of only 14.

posts.author: magaiti
posts.content:
It is possible to open DC 120+ locks, by a team of 2 lvl 40 characters.

- opener: Make a Dexer. Take 38 cleric levels, to get strong Trickery Domain Power. Take Rogue level at clvl 40 for Open Lock skilldump.
~15 (assuming 40 dex buffed) + 20(power) + 20(take 20) + 43(rank) + 13 (foci) = ~111. Might be even a decently playable character, if done right.

- helper: Basically, make a bard with best song possible. 30+ bard levels, high charisma, foci in Perform. Sing for youself to buff your perform further, then sing for the opener to buff his Open Lock skill. That would be ~15-19 to skill, depending on perform ranks (19 requires 100 perform)

With Disarm Traps things get a bit worse, because it is INT-based.
You could make a different dedicated character, but INT-based cleric-rogue just isn't playable.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
A trap or lock handling team is not necessary to reach maximum levels.

Any single assassin- or rogue-based toon can reach effective skill levels of 127 for Set trap & Open locks & 126 (or 127) for Disable trap on high-magic environments where the the ability and skill caps are reachable, hence:

Set trap - A halfling or elven assassin, ranger or rogue or Open lock - A halfling or elven assassin or rogue:
13 (DEX 36) + 6 (ability cap) + 43 (max ranks) + 13 (foci) + 50 (skill cap) + 2 (synergy) = 127, which incidentally is the point where DCs begin to regress on the screen display

Disable trap - Any race assassin or rogue,
12 (INT 34) + 6 (ability cap) + 43 (max ranks) + 13 (foci) + 50 (skill cap) + 2 (synergy) = 126
(Note: A rogue/RDD or assassin/RDD could reach 127 w/INT 36 but it would be one butt-ugly build.)

Skill boosting via Divine trickery or bard song count towards the skill cap so that is only an optional method of reaching the cap, pretty much a non-factor in high-magic.

A custom race, like a PRC one, could potentially raise the starting abilities higher. Also, elevating the skill cap would allow higher skill levels to be attained and consequently higher toon-set trap DCs.

Naturally, when it comes to detection DCs over 35 & disarm DCs over 35, only the rogue class can succeed. However, should a rogue detect an epic trap (for example) and flag it, a non-rogue in the same party could recover it with adequate skill level.

The highest possible trap DC for a toon-based default trap would be any epic one set by a level 40 halfling or elven assassin, ranger or rogue with capped skill & abilities (as described above) is: 58 + 127 = 185.
